nathanrr44:

u dont need to you should be able to atleast spawn it but it wouldnt function correctly server sided such as equipping.

Unless there is argument checking in the ::pickup command that says

if(id < 0 || > 7956) {
    throw new IllegalArgumentException("id must be in domain [0, 7956)");
}

item.title: Torva Issue
item.dc:creator: @nathanrr44 nathanrr44
item.description:
@nathanrr44 wrote:

Basically I Added The Models To My Cache and added the ints etc to my itemdef_2
when i try and spawn the torva plate for example it says item id does not exist. any ideas?
Base [PI]

case 20139: itemDef.modelID = 62699; itemDef.name = "Torva platebody"; itemDef.modelZoom = 1506; itemDef.modelRotationX = 473; itemDef.modelRotationY = 2042; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0; itemDef.anInt165 = 62746; itemDef.anInt200 = 62762; itemDef.groundActions = new String[5]; itemDef.groundActions[2] = "Take"; itemDef.itemActions = new String[5]; itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wear"; itemDef.itemActions[2] = "Check-charges"; itemDef.itemActions[4] = "Drop"; itemDef.description = "Torva platebody".getBytes();//examine. break;

Read full topic
